meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of ice.
meanings.sent1: The pond was icier than the rest of the park.
meanings.sent2: The icier mountain peaks glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The icier sidewalks made walking a slippery adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her stare was as icy and icier than the winter wind.
meanings.sent5: The icier landscape resembled a frozen wonderland.

meanings.definition: Showing no friendliness or warmth in manner; cold.
meanings.sent1: His icier tone indicated he was not in the mood to chat.
meanings.sent2: The icier reception made her feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: Despite his icier demeanor, she tried to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The room fell silent at the icier atmosphere he created.
meanings.sent5: Her icier expression revealed her true feelings.

meanings.sent1: The icier weather required extra layers to stay warm.
meanings.sent2: The icier wind chilled them to the bone.
meanings.sent3: The icier room made her shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His icier breath hung in the frosty air.
meanings.sent5: The icier night air nipped at their noses.
